options.A: Ipsilateral Horner's syndrome

question_text: For patients with ICH whose INR is elevated because of VKAs, what should be done?

options.A: Withhold VKA and administer vitamin K

options.A: Fresh frozen plasma (FFP)

options.A: 30 minutes

question_text: An elderly patient presented to the ER with a history of visual disturbances. On examination, she has right homonymous hemianopia. She can write but is unable to read. A CT brain was performed. What is the location of the infarction?

options.A: Splenium of the corpus callosum

question_text: What is the mechanism of the following antiplatelet agent: Ticagrelor?

options.A: Antagonist of P2Y12
